climbs.name: (Glace imaginaire)
climbs.fa: Benoit Saint-Pierre & Martin Roy, Jan 26 2006 (first recorded).

content.description: There's often a few sections without much ice, bring some rock gear! Il y a souvent des sections sans glace, amenez des pros de roche ! P1 40m Easy snow and ice until you reach the head-wall, belay at a large cedar. Glace et neige facile avant d'atteindre les ressauts jusqu'au relais sous un gros cèdre. P2 40m Easy snow and ice until you reach a 10m vertical section. Neige et glace facile avant d'atteindre un ressaut final de 10m. Benoit Saint-Pierre doesn't think his party were the first to climb the route and he doesn't know the FA party of the name of the route. Lets call it Glace imaginaire for now due to the often lack of ice in some sections. 30m to the left of Voyage imaginaire. 30m à gauche de Voyage imaginaire. Ice gear, small rock pieces. Vis à glaces, petits morceaux de roche.

climbs.name: Bavarois
climbs.fa: Yan Mongrain & François Desrosiers FX Delemote, January 2005

content.description:
Start on thin ice (10-15cm) followed by thicker ice. Départ sur glace mince (10-15cm) et glace épaisse par la suite. Wide flow left of the columns.

Belle cascade large à gauche des colonnes. Screws and rap from V-thread or trees 20m to the left.

Vis et rappel sur lunule ou arbres 20m à gauche.

climbs.name: Champs de choux-fleurs
climbs.fa: Yan Mongrain & François Desrosiers FX Delemote,  January 2005

content.description:
This is the huge pillar left of the area. It has insanely huge mushrooms at the base of the pillar. The route has to be broken in 2 pitches.

P1 WI5 50m
Climb to the base of the pillar through easy ice and oversized mushroom. Climb to pillar until you reach some low angle terrain where you can build a belay.

P2 WI3 30m
Climb straight up thought low angle ice.

Descent : There are slings and rap rings on trees. We did a single 70m rappel which brought us back to the base of the climb.

This is the very obvious pillar on the left side. Can't miss it
Ice screws

Mixed start to reach an obvious free-hanging dagger. Départ en mixte pour rejoindre un glaçon suspendu évident. Right of the columns of Chant de choux-fleurs.

A droite des colonnes du Chant de choux-fleurs. Maybe rock pro, 1 bolt, screws.

Pro de roche possible, 1 plaquette et vis à glace.

Low angled ice with a nice alpine feel.

P1 WI3 60m
Climb straight up thought low angle ice.

P2 WI2 15m
Climb to the left to reach the snow

P3 WI3 15m
Mostly snow that ends with a section of more vertical ice

Descent : There are slings and rap rings on trees on the right.


Ice and snow on the middle of the mountain visible from the lake.

Ice screws

This area is located 130 km north of Montreal. All the climbs are facing south and can be damaged by sun. it's never a crowded area. The approach is about 15-30 mins and can be very easy or a bit more time consuming depending on the availability of parking and snowpack.

L'endroit est situé a 130km au nord de Montréal. Toutes les voies font face au sud et peuvent être endommagées par le soleil.  C'est rarement achalandé. L'approche, entre 15 à 30 minutes, est facile à un peu plus engageante dépendant d’où l'on peu stationner et l’état de la neige.
